questions.question_text: In an environment that has Indexer Clustering, the Monitoring Console (MC) provides dashboards to monitor environment health. As the environment grows over time and new indexers are added, which steps would ensure the MC is aware of the additional indexers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is must applying the changes under the MC setup UI.

https://community.splunk.com/t5/Monitoring-Splunk/new-indexer-not-showing-in-Monitoring-console/m-p/318832
it's B, because when you set up the MC, you actually add the CM and it gives you the indexers information..

B, if the MC is joined to the cluster, the new indexers will appear in the MC but they will not appear in any of the MC dashboards until you go to settings and apply the changes. You should have done this in the Core Implementation labs, if you didnt, you missed points.

A is correct.
For adding or deleting clustered IDXs, the information is automatically updated with information from the CM.For non-IDX nodes, you will need to add them manually.

choices.A: No changes are necessary, the Monitoring Console has self-configuration capabilities.
choices.D: Each new indexer needs to be added using the distributed search UI, then settings must be saved under the MC setup UI.
choices.C: Remove and re-add the cluster master from the indexer clustering UI page to add new peers, then apply the changes under the MC setup UI.
choices.B: Using the MC setup UI, review and apply the changes.

discussion.content:

B is correct

questions.question_text: In addition to the normal responsibilities of a search head cluster captain, which of the following is a default behavior?

choices.B: The captain is a cluster member who performs normal search activities.
choices.C: The captain is not a cluster member but does perform normal search activities.
choices.D: The captain is a cluster member but does not perform normal search activities.
choices.A: The captain is not a cluster member and does not perform normal search activities.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

questions.question_text: What happens to the indexer cluster when the indexer Cluster Master (CM) runs out of disk space?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
(Ref: CI Notes p.369) - Cluster will run as usual, as long as there are no other failures.
B is correct. There is no automatic fail over for indexer cluster. You have to manually bring it up so answer can not be C.
